data.fact: Two members of the cat family are distinct from all others: the clouded leopard and the cheetah. The clouded leopard does not roar like other big cats, nor does it groom or rest like small cats. The cheetah is unique because it is a running cat; all others are leaping cats. They are leaping cats because they slowly stalk their prey and then leap on it.
On average, a cat will sleep for 16 hours a day.
Approximately 40,000 people are bitten by cats in the U.S. annually.
Neutering a male cat will, in almost all cases, stop him from spraying (territorial marking), fighting with other males (at least over females), as well as lengthen his life and improve its quality.
Cats lived with soldiers in trenches, where they killed mice during World War I.
